definition: to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: In 1608, the partnership also took over the Blackfriars indoor theatre.
sentences.chinese: 1608年，黑衣修士劇院也被他們接管。

sentences.english: It's turned that job over to the Gulf Coast Claims Facility, or GCCF.
sentences.chinese: 索賠工作將由港灣海岸索賠機構GCCF接管。

sentences.english: Honest, positive, detailed and courage to meet challenge.
sentences.chinese: 誠篤，踊躍，仔細，敢於接管挑戰。

sentences.english: The day a Chinese multi-billionaire takes over Hollywood will be the time hell freezes over.
sentences.chinese: 中國億萬富翁接管好萊塢的那一天地獄都會凍結。

sentences.english: This is when a deeper wisdom can take over and offer better insights.
sentences.chinese: 這時高深的智慧就接管了一切，並給出更好的見識。

sentences.english: We'll let ourselves in for trouble if we take over this business.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們接管這家企業，我們就會陷入麻煩。

sentences.english: Many  people  complain  that computers are taking over their  jobs。
sentences.chinese: 許多人抱怨說計算機正在接管人的工作。

sentences.english: I think women should accept their traditional role of being housewives.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲婦女理當接管她們傳統的腳色，做家庭婦女。

sentences.english: The right and liabilities of the taken-over bank will not change because of the take-over.
sentences.chinese: 被接管的商業銀行的債權債務關係不因接管而變化。

sentences.english: The right and liabilities of the taken-over bank will not change because of the take-over.
sentences.chinese: 被接管的商業銀行的債權債務關係不因接管而變化。

sentences.english: The suits come almost three years to the day since the companies were taken over by the federal government.
sentences.chinese: 此次訴訟距聯邦政府接管“兩房”的日子已接近三年。

sentences.english: And he stands up in the council and takes over.
sentences.chinese: 之後上帝從委員會中站出來，接管了它。

sentences.english: The new company has duly taken over all accounts outstanding and will take all responsibility for the settlement of accounts。
sentences.chinese: 新的公司已接管了一切未了帳目，並將負責清算。

sentences.english: Allowing professional leagues and the FA additional oversight of club takeovers.
sentences.chinese: 允許職業聯盟和足總監管各俱樂部的接管過程。

sentences.english: Many people complain that computers are taking over their jo .
sentences.chinese: 許多人抱怨說計算機習慣的英語正在接管人的工作。

sentences.english: In the space of a few days, practically the entire banking system has been seized by the government.
sentences.chinese: 短短几天內，整個銀行體系實際上都已被政府接管。

definition: to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to replace/to take over (a position or post)
to dispatch (vehicles, staff etc)/to schedule/to manage/dispatcher/scheduler
to conduct/to command/to direct/conductor (of an orchestra)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to withdraw/to leave/to retreat/to pull out
